ygData.messageBody:
OK, next question ... are the books a requirement to learning Blacksmithing?
or do you read them and gain exp/skill for reading them at which point they
disappear(?) or you are required to hold onto them forever. I will admit I
am only lvl 7 right now so a lot of plat is out of the question but I am
trying new and different things right now. I have gotten my swiming up to
34 (bad, I think), and working on one handed blunt (maxed one handed slash).
I really want to try new things because attacking 2 skeletons with the new
one handed blunt skill is about the only fun I am having right now. Plus I
found a rusted dagger I can purchase cheaply that I can pratice on without
destroying my wepon I want to sharpen.

----- Original Message -----
From: Thormael LGT <thormael@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 5:36 PM
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Re: Sharpening ... Stone


From: "Thormael LGT" <thormael@...>

There are two books for blacksmithing, one is "blacksmith" something
(sorry, forgot) and the other is called "weapons and armors" (or very
close). Dunno which one explains it but you should buy them anyway,
they just cost over 1gp.

If you want the answer here, you have to buy sharpening stones (not
sold everywhere) at 3 or 4cp a piece and then put the rusty weapon
and a sharpening stone in a forge (available somewhere in most
cities, ask around) and then hit combine. If you're lucky you'll get
a taarnished weapon which will be a couple delay points faster! Not
bad. You might however fail and then loose both the wepon and the
stone (lost anyway).

For me sharpening weapons became trivial at a smithing skill of 22. I
think it means that my smithing skill won't increase from it, dunno
if it means I will never be more successful. I succeed most of the
time anyway.

Thormael
